name: Mighty Mouse Canyon
description:
Introduction

A nice, very short and easy Zion canyon with 4 rappels. The most reasonable way to descend this canyon is after a descent of Deadeye Dick canyon since it makes for a much more worthwhile day considering the long-ish approach.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Red tape

Background

properties.name: Bullochs Cabin
properties.description: Bulloch's Cabin. An old broke down cabin in a meadow just off the road on the south side.

properties.name: R1
properties.description: Rap 1 - Mighty Mouse Canyon. Anchored from a chokestone (which feels loose) and drops about 35 feet with teh last 15 feet being on a vertical wall. Down canyon of rap 1 is a very pretty but short slot area with a downclinmb of about 8 feet at the end. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R2
properties.description: Rap 2 - Mighty Mouse Canyon. Anchored from a tree at the top of the drop and drops about 80 feet down a vertical wall into a deep slot. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R3
properties.description: Rap 3 anchored RDC from a pinch point between a boulder and the canyon wall. Rap 3 drops a total of 50 feet with the top being an awkward start over the boulder and the lower portion on a slightly sloped wall. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: R4
properties.description: Rap 4 is the place for this waypoint and is about 50 feet down canyon of rap 3. Rap 4 can be anchored from rocks or logs and drops about 20 feet. Rap 4 can be downclimbed through a rabbit hole on the LDC side but be careful since the rock is very slick here. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: Might Mouse Approach Start
properties.description: To get up to Mighty Mouse Canyon leave the Virgin River here and scramble up to the ridge line to the RDC (north) side. The scramble route is slightly up canyon of a large obvious outcropping at the apex of the bend in the river here. (Data by bluugnome.com)
